H0.text: name three large lakes other than the great lakes in the united states. Lake Mead

H1.text: name three large lakes other than the great lakes in the united states. Lake Powell

H2.text: name three large lakes other than the great lakes in the united states. Lake Sakakawea

H3.text: name three large lakes other than the great lakes in the united states. Iliamna Lake

A4.text: Lake Mead is the largest reservoir in the US in terms of water capacity.

A5.text: Lake Powell is a reservoir of similar size to Lake Mead.

A6.text: Lake Sakakawea is the third largest in the United States by volume, after Lake Mead and Lake Powell.

A7.text: Lake Sakakawea is the largest man-made lake located entirely within North Dakota.
